intro: Acourtia wislizeni var. megacephala, commonly known as the giant desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its large, woolly leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are typically arranged in a rosette pattern, which helps to conserve water. The species is adapted to full sun and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for desert ecosystems.
